title: Fasteners & Hardware Quiz
description: How well do you know nails, screws, bolts, and other fasteners? Test your knowledge of these essential hardware items.

questions.question: Which fastener has a slotted or Phillips head and spiraling threads along its shaft?
What is the difference between a bolt and a screw?
options: Screws are always made of steel
Bolts typically require a nut on the other end, while screws thread directly into material

questions.question: Which type of nail has a large, flat head and is used to attach roofing shingles?
What is a wing nut?
options: A nut with two flat extensions (wings) for hand-tightening without tools
A nut shaped like a hexagon

questions.question: Which screw head type has a cross-shaped slot and is one of the most common types?
What is a cotter pin used for?
options: Securing a bolt or pin by bending its split ends after insertion

questions.question: Which fastener is a smooth metal pin driven into material by a hammer?
What is a lock washer designed to do?
options: Prevent a nut or bolt from loosening due to vibration

questions.question: Which type of screw is designed for attaching drywall (plasterboard) to wood or metal studs?
What is a rivet?
options: A permanent fastener that is inserted through holes and deformed on one end to hold pieces together

questions.question: Which heavy-duty screw has a hexagonal head and is used to fasten wood to wood or wood to metal?
What does the 'd' stand for in nail sizing (e.g., 16d nail)?
Which fastener has no head and is threaded on both ends, used to join two components with nuts?
What is a finish nail characterized by?
options: A very small head that can be set below the wood surface and concealed

questions.question: Which type of anchor expands behind drywall by opening toggle wings when pushed through a hole?
